intro: Schmidelia mollis, commonly known as the soft schmidelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Schmidelia mollis thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
